fields.description: Hi All, Trying to invoke a DescribeInstances against the 3.3.0-devel cloud, it appears to not respond correctly and error out: The Call {code} ## T 10.104.1.151:48015 -> 10.104.1.150:8773 [AP] AWSAccessKeyId=T28RFIWM39ZQQR3W5IVVO&Action=DescribeInstances&InstanceId.0=i-2C674381&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-03-19T19%3A02%3A55Z&Version=2010-08-31&Signature=WAfty%2F%2BnRY0frDDR8DJ5tESSdN9fn7nt3Mc8ujuR%2Buk%3D ## {code} The error {code} T 10.104.1.150:8773 -> 10.104.1.151:48015 [AP] HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 400 Bad RequestFailed to bind the following fields: InstanceId.0 = i-2C674381 Failed to bind the following fields: InstanceId.0 = i-2C674381 ##### {code} CLC should support the new parameter scheme for DescribeInstances which is documented here http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeInstances.html This makes Eucalyptus not work with AWS compatible tools like Fog for example. Please let me know if there any further questions. Cheers! Deependra

comments.body:
Fog details

Version: fog-1.10.0

{code}
   env[:aws_compute] = Fog::Compute.new({
            :provider => :aws,
	    :aws_access_key_id => access_key_id,
	    :aws_secret_access_key => secret_access_key,
 	    :endpoint => 'http://10.104.1.150:8773/services/Eucalyptus',
	    :version => "2010-08-31",
            :region => 'eucalyptus'
          })
{code}

Vagrant details:

Version: 1.1.1

Configuration

{code}
# -*- mode: ruby -*-
# vi: set ft=ruby :
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "euca-centos"

  config.vm.provider :aws do |aws|
    aws.access_key_id = "T28RFIWM39ZQQR3W5IVVO"
    aws.secret_access_key = "rcvoSHWQvm4dPT2Xf6IsHpJCvvpT834oui4gFONT"
    aws.keypair_name = "sshlogin"
    aws.ssh_private_key_path = "/root/sshlogin"
    aws.ami = "emi-8B2B40FB"
    aws.ssh_username = "root"
  end
end
{code}

Did testing using lastest version of fog (1.10.0).  Was able to confirm against AWS EC2, then against Eucalyptus 3.3.0-devel.

*Eucalyptus 3.3.0-devel*

{code}
1.9.3p194 :028 > connection = Fog::Compute.new({
1.9.3p194 :029 >       :provider => "AWS",
1.9.3p194 :030 >       :aws_access_key_id => "T28RFIWM39ZQQR3W5IVVO",
1.9.3p194 :031 >       :aws_secret_access_key => "rcvoSHWQvm4dPT2Xf6IsHpJCvvpT834oui4gFONT",
1.9.3p194 :032 >       :endpoint => "http://10.104.1.150:8773/services/Eucalyptus",
1.9.3p194 :033 >       :region => "eucalyptus",
1.9.3p194 :034 >       :version => "2010-08-31"})
1.9.3p194 :035 > connection.describe_instances
 => #<Excon::Response:0x007ffb8bddc7a8 @body={"reservationSet"=>[]}, @headers={"Content-Length"=>"121", "Content-Type"=>"application/xml; charset=UTF-8"}, @status=200>
{code}

Even with different _version_ values, there wasn't a correct response:

{code}
....
:version => "2011-01-01"})
1.9.3p194 :043 > connection.describe_instances
 => #<Excon::Response:0x007ffb8bcf3530 @body={"reservationSet"=>[]}, @headers={"Content-Length"=>"121", "Content-Type"=>"application/xml; charset=UTF-8"}, @status=200>
.....
:version => "2012-10-01"})
1.9.3p194 :057 > connection.describe_instances
 => #<Excon::Response:0x007ffb8ba965d0 @body={"reservationSet"=>[]}, @headers={"Content-Length"=>"121", "Content-Type"=>"application/xml; charset=UTF-8"}, @status=200>
{code}
I think the problem here is that the param is ".0" ("InstanceId.0"), but we expect a non-zero index (so ".1" is the first item). I have not verified that this is the issue.

Hi [~sjones],

Yes that appears to be the case, I just changed the following code in fog

{code}
        # {Amazon API Reference}[http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeInstances.html]
        def describe_instances(filters = {})
          unless filters.is_a?(Hash)
            Fog::Logger.deprecation("describe_instances with #{filters.class} param is deprecated, use describe_instances('instance-id' => []) instead [light_black](#{caller.first})[/]")
            filters = {'instance-id' => [*filters]}
          end
          params = {}
          if filters['instance-id']
            instance_ids = filters.delete('instance-id')
            instance_ids = [instance_ids] unless instance_ids.is_a?(Array)
            instance_ids.each_with_index do |id, index|
              params.merge!("InstanceId.#{index+1}" => id)
            end
          end
          params.merge!(Fog::AWS.indexed_filters(filters))

          request({
            'Action'    => 'DescribeInstances',
            :idempotent => true,
            :parser     => Fog::Parsers::Compute::AWS::DescribeInstances.new
          }.merge!(params))
        end

      end
{code}

Specifically, only the following line in the above method

{code}
              params.merge!("InstanceId.#{index+1}" => id)
{code}

This seems to have fixed the issue, do you think it is a workaround and should be fixed in Eucalyptus or is it the expected behaviour  ? It seems to work without the "+1" on AWS.

Thanks again for your quick help!

Cheers!
Deependra
I think we should address this in Eucalyptus (assuming the fix is reasonably clean and simple), as you say it should improve tool compatibility.
[~dshekhawat], can you verify this solved the issue and then click "Approve fix for release".   Thanks!
